author: cautiousfox
title: KILT & Cardano
description: There is a mutual interest to connect Cardano and the Polkadot/Kusama communities. But pioneers are needed to initiate the collaboration.

f6_assessments.q0: The team realizes that there is a potential connecting piece between the Polkadot and Cardano ecosystem. This is something that is really important within the ecosystem due to the high influence on interoperability. There are many people that would love to see these 2 blockchains connect and help each other to build and excel in the space. There is currently a challenge of igniting the flame and actually following through with this idea. The team has given a great approach to what the challenge is and how they are going to address it. For this reason, I give it 4 out of 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is very experienced in these different ecosystems and have a willingness to help connect these different communities. This will allow for new people to get introduced to blockchain technology. The team has already shown their expertise in their individual careers and are now taking a project that could potentially increase the amount of capital in these different blockchain ecosystems. The team has slight concern that there is a possibility that these ecosystems will be harder to connect than they would want. This proposal is to kickstart ideas and start brainstorming on what will be the best way to start finding the connecting pieces. For this reason, I give this proposal a 4 out of 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q2: The team has provided a detailed plan and roadmap that will help them to track their progress along the way. I like that they focus on having a coordinator that will help them monitor their progress along their journey. The funds they are requesting are very considerate of other projects building in the Cardano ecosystem and they have a lot of great ideas that will help these ecosystems to flourish with new investors. For this reason, I give this proposal a 4 out of 5 stars.

f6_assessments.q0: The project is clear about the problem-one of limited cross chain collaboration. The solution is aligned with the challenge of increasing cross chain collaboration and interoperability, and in this instance, specifically Cardano and Polkadot/Kusama. Increased collaboration will increase the usability of chains and this furthers the mission, and also offers additional benefit to the community. The KPIs related specifically to facilitating engagement between both communities, and ideas for collaboration in development.
f6_assessments.q1: The team collectively have experience both of the development as well as the communities for Cardano and Polkadot, with one of the team members having been a CMO at Polkadot. The team required to engage and deliver is established, and there is a clear timeline and breakdown of activity on the roadmap. Activities range from preparation and training to innovation and coordination, with events to support each. The timeline is a realistic one, with engagement and reports by June and cross chain technical frameworks by the end of the year. The team is clear on risks when exploring new territory and have identified  potential for the project to still have positive outcomes for the challenge aims and the community. For a minimal amount of funds, this could offer some great potential collaborative opportunities.
f6_assessments.q2: The timeline and activity is clearly defined, but what is not specific are some of the metrics- for example, the numbers of participants that will be engaged at a minimum. The activity can however be easily auditable as the events are public and reports will be submitted.

f6_assessments.q0: The team behind this proposal aims to host three events to encourage collaboration between Dotsama and Cardano developers. The inevitability of interoperability can not be denied, however there is still not much initiatives that gravitates towards that agenda. The slow pace of progress maybe due to lack of communication, collaboration and coordination between the communities. In order to progress forward, we need to encourage collaboration to build the future of decentralized networks together. This proposal fits perfectly within that challenge. With this event, hopefully the communities from all sides can find the common ground and share resources, skills and ideas to collectively build the bridges between chains.
f6_assessments.q1: The team behind the proposal are experienced and has the skills to implement the project. The proposer knows the required manpower and also the resources to ensure the success of the project. Moreover, the budget requested are reasonable and are presented in a clear and straight forward way. Moreover, the proposer identifies the risk and challenges when implementing this plan which is the outcome of the initial research, experimentation and discussion is that these blockchains are not interoperable. It is understandable for the uncertain outcome since we are trying an error to solve something that has not been done before. Furthermore, it is noted that the proposer presented with a straight forward plan on how to execute this project. The timeframe offered are also realistic. Therefore, with the information provided above, it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal provided with a clear roadmap for its achievement. Moreover, the KPI set by the proposer is not concrete but hopefully it will be as a stepping stone for the communities to start engaging each other and develop a better sense of direction on what it is to come . The community can keep track of their progress thru their discord and also catalyst every 2-3 weeks. In conclusion, the information provided is sufficient to be audited.

f6_assessments.q0: KILT is a chain focused on decentralized ids and verifiable credentials. The proposal plans to explore the possibility of connecting Cardano apps to KILT, making credentials interoperable. It seems the team assumes the link would be just in one direction (cardano apps using KILT credentials, not the other way around), while probably the most value would be added with a bidirectional integration, but I guess that's something that might come up during the sessions they plan to conduct.
f6_assessments.q1: This is an exploratory proposal, so the full plan consists on different events where KILT and Cardano communities will discuss a possible integration. My criteria to consider the proposal successfully implemented would be that the sessions effectively come up with a plan to provide interoperability, with the risk being that no progress is made during the talks. With that in mind, I think the team is adequate for the task, as they seem technically oriented enough to zero in on a plan in a few sessions. The budget is appropriate for the work being done.
f6_assessments.q2: Sessions will be accessible, so the progress will be easily tracked. I'm confused, however, about the final deliverable. The project plan mentions a report due in June, but that is not mentioned in the auditability section, indicating instead that results will be showcased no later than October in  an After Townhall session. They also mention a Fund9 proposal (which should be the main deliverable, in my view), that should be ready for the summer.

solution: KILT is a Kusama parachain in the Dotsama ecosystem, and will host a series of three events to ignite collaboration with Cardano developers.
experience: Christine Mohan is the VP of Business Development at KILT, a blockchain identity protocol for issuing self-sovereign credentials and decentralized identifiers. Paul Pomerleau handles developer relations at KILT. Tomi Astikainen understands both Cardano and Dotsama communities.
